00077   /**************************************************************************/
00092   /**************************************************************************/
00093   template <typename PtrType>
00094   PtrType* OffsetPtr(PtrType* thePtr, int bytes){
00095     // Cast it to size_t to add the bytes to it, and recast it back
00096     return reinterpret_cast<PtrType*>(reinterpret_cast<size_t>(thePtr) + bytes);
00097   }
00098   
00099   /**************************************************************************/
00114   /**************************************************************************/
00115   bool CheckPattern(unsigned char* thePtr, size_t amt, unsigned char pattern){
00116     // Whether it is corrupted or not
00117     bool isCorrupted = false;
00118     // Check through all the bytes
00119     while (amt > 0){
00120       // Check whether that byte is the same code as the pattern
00121       if ((*thePtr) != pattern){
00122         // PROBLEM, not the padding pattern
00123         isCorrupted = true;
00124         break;
00125       }
00126       else{
00127         // Go to next padding byte
00128         thePtr = OffsetPtr(thePtr, sizeof(unsigned char));
00129       }
00130       // Decrement amt
00131       --amt;
00132     }
00133     // Return the status
00134     return isCorrupted;
00135   }

00150     
00151     static const int HDR_ALLOC_OFFSET = HDR_FLAGS_OFFSET - 
00152     static_cast<int>(sizeof(unsigned));
00154

00156     static_cast<int>(sizeof(unsigned short));
00159

00161                                                     + sizeof(unsigned char));
00164

00166                                        static_cast<int>(sizeof(unsigned short));

00175     /**************************************************************************/
00192     /**************************************************************************/
00193     void CreateMemBlockInfo(MemBlockInfo*& thePtr,bool inUse,unsigned aNum,
00194     const char*& label) throw(OAException){
00195       // Try to allocate for a new memblockinfo
00196       try{ thePtr = new MemBlockInfo(); }
00197       // Problem allocation, throw another exception
00198       catch (std::bad_alloc& ba)
00199       { throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, ba.what())); }
00200       // Assign in-use
00201       thePtr->in_use = inUse;
00202       // Assign the allocation num
00203       thePtr->alloc_num = aNum;
00204       // Dynamically allocate the string
00205       if (label){
00206         // Try to new
00207         try{ thePtr->label = new char[strlen(label)+1]; }
00208         // Problem allocation, throw another exception
00209         catch (std::bad_alloc& ba)
00210         { throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, ba.what())); }
00211         // Copy it over
00212         strcpy(thePtr->label, label);
00213       }
00214       else thePtr->label = NULL;
00215     }

00230       if (theInfo->label) delete [] theInfo->label;
00231       // delete the info
00232       delete theInfo;
00233       // set it to NULL
00234       theInfo = NULL;
00235     }

00354 /**************************************************************************/
00365 /**************************************************************************/
00366 ObjectAllocator::ObjectAllocator(size_t ObjectSize, const OAConfig& config) 
00367                                  throw(OAException) : 
00368                                  _config(config), _stats(),
00369                                  _freeList(NULL), _pageList(NULL) 
00370 {
00371   // Set up the OA Stats
00372   _stats = OAStats();
00373   _stats.ObjectSize_ = ObjectSize;
00374   // Calculates the amount of memory per page
00375   _stats.PageSize_ = GetPageSize(ObjectSize, _config);
00376   // Allocates a page of memory first
00377   _pageList = AddPage();
00378   // And set the next of it to be NULL
00379   _pageList->Next = NULL;
00380 }
00381 
00382 /**************************************************************************/
00387 /**************************************************************************/
00388 ObjectAllocator::~ObjectAllocator() throw()
00389 {
00390   // Clear all the pages
00391   while (_pageList){
00392     // Grab the next page
00393     GenericObject* nextPage = _pageList->Next;
00394     // Free the current page
00395     FreePage(_pageList);
00396     // Set page list to the next page
00397     _pageList = nextPage;
00398   }
00399 }

00401 /**************************************************************************/
00414 /**************************************************************************/
00415 void * ObjectAllocator::Allocate(const char *label) throw(OAException){
00416   // if the CPP memory manager is enabled, just use it.
00417   if (_config.UseCPPMemManager_){
00418     // The object which will be allocated
00419     char* theObject = NULL;
00420     // Attempt to allocate space for it
00421     try{ theObject = new char[_stats.ObjectSize_];}
00422     // Failed to get space!
00423     catch (std::bad_alloc& ba)
00424     { throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, ba.what())); }
00425     // Succeede! Increment and return the object
00426     ++_stats.ObjectsInUse_ ; ++_stats.MostObjects_; ++_stats.Allocations_;
00427     return theObject;
00428   } // If there isn't any objects on the free list, add a page first
00429   if (!_freeList){
00430     // Add a page
00431     GenericObject* newPage = AddPage();
00432     // Add it to the page list
00433     newPage->Next = _pageList; _pageList = newPage;
00434   }
00435   // Grab the first one and increment allocations
00436   GenericObject* theObj = PopFront(); _stats.Allocations_++;
00437   // If it has no header, don't bother creating the header
00438   if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ != OAConfig::hbNone){
00439     // if it is NOT external
00440     if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ != OAConfig::hbExternal){
00441       // Grab the flags and set it to true
00442       Header::GetFlags(theObj, _config.PadBytes_) = true;
00443       // Grab the alloc num and set it to the new allocations
00444       Header::GetAlloc(theObj, _config.PadBytes_) = _stats.Allocations_;
00445       // if it is extended, set up the use count and zero out the user area
00446       if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExtended){
00447         // Increment use count
00448         ++(Header::GetUseCount(theObj, _config.PadBytes_));
00449         // Set up user defined as all 0s
00450         char& firstByte = Header::GetUserDefined(theObj,
00451                           _config.HBlockInfo_.additional_,_config.PadBytes_);
00452        std::memset(&firstByte, 0, _config.HBlockInfo_.additional_);
00453       }
00454     } // if it IS external, grab the external pointer area and set it up
00455     else{
00456       // Grab the external pointer area and set it up
00457       MemBlockInfo*& memBlock = Header::GetMemBlockInfo(theObj
00458                                                       ,_config.PadBytes_);
00459       Header::CreateMemBlockInfo(memBlock,true,_stats.Allocations_,label);
00460     }
00461   }
00462   // If it is debug, set up all the values as the pattern first
00463   if (_config.DebugOn_)std::memset(theObj,ALLOCATED_PATTERN,_stats.ObjectSize_);
00464   // Increment objects in use and return the object
00465   ++_stats.ObjectsInUse_ ; ++_stats.MostObjects_;
00466   return theObj;
00467 }
00468 
00469 /**************************************************************************/
00478 /**************************************************************************/
00479 void ObjectAllocator::Free(void *Object) throw(OAException){
00480   // if the CPP memory manager is enabled, just use it.
00481   if (_config.UseCPPMemManager_) delete [] reinterpret_cast<char*>(Object);
00482   else{
00483     // If it is a nullptr, ERROR, throw exception
00484     if (!Object) 
00485     throw(OAException(OAException::E_MULTIPLE_FREE, "Free: Invalid Object"));
00486     // Cast it to a GenericObject*
00487     GenericObject* theObj = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(Object);
00488     // If debug is on, do the checks first
00489     if (_config.DebugOn_){
00490       // If there is padding, check the padding
00491       if (_config.PadBytes_) CheckPadding(theObj);
00492       // Check whether it is on the boundaries
00493       CheckOnBoundary(theObj);
00494       // Check whether its in the free list
00495       if (_freeList) CheckInFreeList(theObj);
00496     }
00497     // Check the headers next if there are any, and set it up
00498     switch (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_){
00499       // if it is external, destroy the memblockinfo
00500       case OAConfig::hbExternal:{
00501         // Grab the external pointer area
00502         MemBlockInfo*& theHeader = Header::GetMemBlockInfo(theObj,
00503                                                           _config.PadBytes_);
00504         // Check whether it is in use
00505         if ((theHeader && theHeader->in_use) || !_config.DebugOn_){
00506           // Destroy it
00507           Header::DestroyMemBlockInfo(theHeader);
00508           // And set it to null
00509           theHeader = NULL;
00510         }
00511         // If it is unused, BAD BOY
00512         else throw(OAException(OAException::E_MULTIPLE_FREE,"Multiple frees"));
00513       } break;
00514       // If it isn't, use regular checks
00515       case OAConfig::hbBasic:
00516       case OAConfig::hbExtended:
00517       // Set the flag to unused if it is used
00518       if (Header::GetFlags(theObj, _config.PadBytes_) || !_config.DebugOn_){
00519         Header::GetFlags(theObj, _config.PadBytes_) = false;
00520         Header::GetAlloc(theObj, _config.PadBytes_) = 0;
00521       }
00522       // If it is unused, BAD BOY
00523       else throw(OAException(OAException::E_MULTIPLE_FREE, "Multiple frees"));
00524       break;
00525       // If it is noHeader, no header check/setting
00526       case OAConfig::hbNone:
00527       break;
00528     }
00529     // If it is debug mode, memset hte pattern
00530     if (_config.DebugOn_)std::memset(theObj, FREED_PATTERN, _stats.ObjectSize_);
00531     // Pass it back into the free list
00532     PushFront(theObj);
00533   }
00534   // Increment deallocs and decrement objects in use
00535   ++_stats.Deallocations_; --_stats.ObjectsInUse_;
00536 }
00537 
00538 /**************************************************************************/
00550 /**************************************************************************/
00551 unsigned ObjectAllocator::DumpMemoryInUse(DUMPCALLBACK fn) const {
00552   // Number of blocks found
00553   unsigned numOfBlocks = 0;
00554   // Traverse the pages
00555   GenericObject* pagePtr = _pageList;
00556   while (pagePtr){
00557     // Traverse through the headers
00558     GenericObject* headerPtr = GetFirstHeader(pagePtr);
00559     for (size_t i = 0; i < _config.ObjectsPerPage_; ++i){
00560       // Whether it is in use
00561       bool inUse = false;
00562       switch (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_){
00563         // If there is no header, traverse through it manually
00564         case OAConfig::hbNone:
00565         { // Grab the data
00566           GenericObject* theData = GetDataPtr(headerPtr);
00567           // Check through the free list
00568           GenericObject* freeListPtr = _freeList;
00569           while (freeListPtr){
00570             // Found it in the free list, DON'T call it
00571             if (freeListPtr == theData) break;
00572             freeListPtr = freeListPtr->Next;
00573           }
00574           // If it is Null, its in use
00575           if (!freeListPtr)inUse = true;
00576         } break;
00577         // If it is external, grab ptr to mem block
00578         case OAConfig::hbExternal:
00579         { // Grab the header
00580           MemBlockInfo* theHeaderPtr=reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo*>(headerPtr);
00581           // If it is used, use function
00582           if (theHeaderPtr->in_use) inUse = true;
00583         } break;
00584         // If it is basic or extended, just check the useflags
00585         case OAConfig::hbBasic:
00586         case OAConfig::hbExtended:
00587         if (Header::GetFlags(GetDataPtr(headerPtr),_config.PadBytes_))
00588           inUse = true;
00589         break;
00590       }
00591       // if it is in use, call the function
00592       if (inUse){
00593         // Grab the data
00594         GenericObject* theData = GetDataPtr(headerPtr);
00595         // Call the function
00596         fn(theData, _stats.ObjectSize_);
00597         // Increment the number of blocks found
00598         ++numOfBlocks;
00599       }
00600       // Move to the next header if it is not the last
00601       if (i != _config.ObjectsPerPage_ -1) headerPtr = GetNextHeader(headerPtr);
00602     } // Go to the next page
00603     pagePtr = pagePtr->Next;
00604   }
00605   return numOfBlocks;
00606 }
00607 
00608 /**************************************************************************/
00620 /**************************************************************************/
00621 unsigned ObjectAllocator::ValidatePages(VALIDATECALLBACK fn) const{
00622   // The number of potentially corrupted pages
00623   unsigned numOfPages = 0;
00624   // Traverse the pages
00625   GenericObject* pagePtr = _pageList;
00626   while (pagePtr){
00627     // Traverse through the headers
00628     GenericObject* headerPtr = GetFirstHeader(pagePtr);
00629     for (size_t i = 0; i < _config.ObjectsPerPage_; ++i){
00630       // Whether it is corrupted or not
00631       bool isCorrupted = false;
00632       // Store the pointer to the padding start
00633       unsigned char* checkPtr = OffsetPtr(
00634                                 reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(headerPtr), 
00635                                 static_cast<int>(_config.HBlockInfo_.size_));
00636       // What will be used to check the padding
00637       unsigned char* padCheckPtr = checkPtr;
00638       // If padding exists, check the front and the back padding
00639       if (_config.PadBytes_ && _config.DebugOn_){
00640         // Check the front padding
00641         isCorrupted = CheckPattern(padCheckPtr, _config.PadBytes_, PAD_PATTERN);
00642         // If it is NOT corrupted, carry on checking
00643         if (!isCorrupted){
00644           // Move past the data
00645           checkPtr = OffsetPtr(checkPtr,
00646                         static_cast<int>(_stats.ObjectSize_+_config.PadBytes_));
00647           // Check corrupted of the other padding
00648           isCorrupted = CheckPattern(checkPtr, _config.PadBytes_, PAD_PATTERN);
00649         }
00650       }
00651       // Done checking the block, if it is corrupted, call validate
00652       if (isCorrupted){
00653         GenericObject* dataPtr = GetDataPtr(headerPtr);
00654         fn(dataPtr,_stats.ObjectSize_);
00655         ++numOfPages;
00656       }
00657       // Move to the next one if it isn't the last one
00658       if (i != _config.ObjectsPerPage_-1) headerPtr = GetNextHeader(headerPtr);
00659     }
00660     // Go to the next pagePtr
00661     pagePtr = pagePtr->Next;
00662   }
00663   // Return the num of pages
00664   return numOfPages;
00665 }
00666 
00667 /**************************************************************************/
00675 /**************************************************************************/
00676 unsigned ObjectAllocator::FreeEmptyPages(void){
00677   // If the amount in the free list is less than the page amount allowed, NONE
00678   if (_stats.FreeObjects_ < _config.ObjectsPerPage_) return 0;
00679   // Stores the number of pages
00680   unsigned numOfPages = 0;
00681   // Traverse the pages
00682   GenericObject* pagePtr = _pageList;
00683   GenericObject* prevPagePtr = NULL;
00684   while (pagePtr){
00685     // Whether there are any blocks used
00686     bool pageIsUsed;
00687     // If it is not NONE, call the non-NONE version
00688     if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ != OAConfig::hbNone)
00689       // Check whether it is an empty page
00690       pageIsUsed = IsEmptyPage_Header(pagePtr);
00691     // if it is NONE, call the NONE version
00692     else pageIsUsed = IsEmptyPage_NoHeader(pagePtr);
00693     // If the page is NOT used, free the page
00694     if (!pageIsUsed){
00695       // Grab the next page
00696       GenericObject* nextPagePtr = pagePtr->Next;
00697       // Clear the old page
00698       FreePage(pagePtr);
00699       // Set pagePtr to the next
00700       pagePtr = nextPagePtr;
00701       // If it is not the first page, set the prev page to point to that
00702       if (prevPagePtr) prevPagePtr->Next = pagePtr;
00703       // If it is, set the page list to begin from that
00704       else _pageList = pagePtr;
00705       ++numOfPages;
00706     }
00707     // if it is used, just go to the next page
00708     else{
00709       prevPagePtr = pagePtr;
00710       pagePtr = pagePtr->Next;
00711     }
00712   }
00713   return numOfPages;
00714 }

00801 /* Private functions */
00802 // Exception checking functions
00803 /**************************************************************************/
00813 /**************************************************************************/
00814 void ObjectAllocator::CheckInFreeList(GenericObject* theObj) const 
00815 throw(OAException){
00816   // Check free list, Loop through free list lookin for whether it is in free
00817   GenericObject* listPtr = _freeList;
00818   while(listPtr){
00819     // Check whether it is in the free list, throw if it is
00820     if (listPtr == reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(theObj))
00821     throw(OAException(OAException::E_MULTIPLE_FREE, "Free: Multiple free!!"));
00822     listPtr = listPtr->Next;
00823   }
00824 }
00825 
00826 /**************************************************************************/
00834 /**************************************************************************/
00835 void ObjectAllocator::CheckPadding(GenericObject* theObj) const 
00836 throw(OAException) {
00837   // If padding exists, check the front and the back padding
00838   if (_config.PadBytes_){
00839     // Grab the padding
00840     unsigned char* padChckPtr=OffsetPtr(reinterpret_cast<unsigned char*>(theObj)
00841     , -static_cast<int>(_config.PadBytes_));
00842     // Check the front padding
00843     bool isCorrupted = CheckPattern(padChckPtr, _config.PadBytes_, PAD_PATTERN);
00844     // If it is NOT corrupted, carry on checking
00845     if (!isCorrupted){
00846       // Move past the data
00847       padChckPtr = OffsetPtr(padChckPtr, 
00848                    static_cast<int>(_stats.ObjectSize_+_config.PadBytes_));
00849       // Check the padding again
00850       isCorrupted = CheckPattern(padChckPtr, _config.PadBytes_, PAD_PATTERN);
00851     }
00852     // if it is corrupted now, THROW
00853     if (isCorrupted) 
00854     throw(OAException(OAException::E_CORRUPTED_BLOCK,"Data corrupted!"));
00855   }
00856 }
00857 
00858 /**************************************************************************/
00867 /**************************************************************************/
00868 void ObjectAllocator::CheckOnBoundary(GenericObject* theObj) const
00869 throw(OAException){
00870   // The address of the object
00871   size_t objAddress = reinterpret_cast<size_t>(theObj);
00872   // Find the list you are on
00873   GenericObject* listPtr = _pageList;
00874   // Address of the list
00875   size_t listAddr = reinterpret_cast<size_t>(listPtr);
00876   while(listPtr){
00877     // If the address is within the list, its "in" the list area
00878     if ((objAddress>listAddr) && (objAddress<(listAddr+_stats.PageSize_)))
00879       break;
00880     // If not, carry on
00881     listPtr = listPtr->Next;
00882     if (listPtr) listAddr = reinterpret_cast<size_t>(listPtr);
00883   }
00884   // if it couldn't find any of them, NOT ON BOUNDARY, THROW
00885   if (!listPtr) throw(OAException(OAException::E_BAD_BOUNDARY,
00886                       "Bad boundary, not in list!"));
00887   // Address offset of the object relative to the list
00888   int ptrOffset = static_cast<int>(objAddress) - static_cast<int>(listAddr);
00889   // If it has alignment, check against the alignment
00890   if (_config.Alignment_){
00891     // NOT ALIGNED
00892     if (ptrOffset%_config.Alignment_) 
00893     throw(OAException(OAException::E_BAD_BOUNDARY,"Bad boundary, unaligned!"));
00894   }
00895   // Else, check against the object sizes manually
00896   else{
00897     // Remove the list ptr,the first padding and header and check
00898     ptrOffset-=static_cast<int>(sizeof(GenericObject*)+
00899     _config.PadBytes_+_config.HBlockInfo_.size_);
00900     // First member?
00901     if (ptrOffset == 0) return;
00902     // if it is NOT negative and it is a multiple of the ObjectSize, FOUND!
00903     if ((ptrOffset%(_stats.ObjectSize_+_config.PadBytes_*2+
00904     _config.HBlockInfo_.size_))==0) return;
00905     // If not, THROW
00906     else 
00907     throw(OAException(OAException::E_BAD_BOUNDARY,"Bad boundary, unaligned!"));
00908   }
00909 }

00925 /**************************************************************************/
00926 GenericObject* ObjectAllocator::GetDataPtr(GenericObject* theHeader) const{
00927   return OffsetPtr(theHeader,static_cast<int>(_config.HBlockInfo_.size_+
00928                                               _config.PadBytes_));
00929 }

00931 /**************************************************************************/
00943 /**************************************************************************/
00944 GenericObject* ObjectAllocator::GetFirstHeader(GenericObject* theList) const{
00945   return OffsetPtr(theList, 
00946                    static_cast<int>(sizeof(theList)+_config.LeftAlignSize_));
00947 }

00949 /**************************************************************************/
00961 /**************************************************************************/
00962 GenericObject* ObjectAllocator::GetNextHeader(GenericObject* prevHdr) const{
00963   return OffsetPtr(prevHdr,static_cast<int>(_config.HBlockInfo_.size_+
00964   (_config.PadBytes_*2+_stats.ObjectSize_+_config.InterAlignSize_)));
00965 }

00967 // Page functions

00969 /**************************************************************************/
00978 /**************************************************************************/
00979 GenericObject* ObjectAllocator::AddPage() throw(OAException){
00980   // Check how many pages are allocated, throw if there are too many
00981   if (_stats.PagesInUse_ == _config.MaxPages_) 
00982     throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_PAGES, "Allocate: Not enough pages"));
00983   // Store the size of a generic pointer (used very often)
00984   unsigned ptrSize = sizeof(GenericObject*);
00985   // Allocates a page of memory first
00986   unsigned char* theCharPtr = NULL;
00987   try{ theCharPtr = new unsigned char[_stats.PageSize_]; }
00988   // Problem allocation, throw another exception
00989   catch (std::bad_alloc& ba){
00990     throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, ba.what()));
00991   }
00992   GenericObject* pagePtr = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(theCharPtr);
00993   //(NextPtr)Skip the next ptr for the page(at the header now)
00994   theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr, ptrSize);
00995   //(LeftAlign)If debug is on, set up pattern in the left align
00996   if (_config.DebugOn_ && _config.LeftAlignSize_)
00997     std::memset(theCharPtr, ALIGN_PATTERN, _config.LeftAlignSize_);
00998   //(LeftAlign)Finished with LeftAlign, move on
00999   theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,_config.LeftAlignSize_);
01000   //(DB:Start)Iterate for all the elements
01001   for (size_t i = 0; i < _config.ObjectsPerPage_; ++i){
01002     //(DB:Header) Only act if there is any header, memset all to 0
01003     if (_config.HBlockInfo_.size_)
01004       std::memset(theCharPtr, 0, _config.HBlockInfo_.size_);
01005     //(DB:Header)Finished with header block, move on
01006     theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,
01007                  static_cast<int>(_config.HBlockInfo_.size_));
01008     //(DB:PaddingStart)If debug is on, set up the pad pattern in the padding
01009     if (_config.DebugOn_ && _config.PadBytes_)
01010       std::memset(theCharPtr, PAD_PATTERN, _config.PadBytes_);
01011     //(DB:PaddingStart)Finished with padding block, move on
01012     theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,_config.PadBytes_);
01013     //(DB:Data)Create the next ptr for the data block
01014     GenericObject* blockPtr = reinterpret_cast<GenericObject*>(theCharPtr);
01015     //(DB:Data)Make this the head of the free list
01016     PushFront(blockPtr);
01017     //(DB:Data)Finished with data ptr, move on
01018     theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,ptrSize);
01019     //(DB:DataIn)If debug is on, set up the unallocated pattern in the data
01020     if (_config.DebugOn_)
01021       std::memset(theCharPtr, UNALLOCATED_PATTERN, _stats.ObjectSize_-ptrSize);
01022     //(DB:DataIn)Finished with the data block, move on
01023     theCharPtr= OffsetPtr(theCharPtr, static_cast<int>(_stats.ObjectSize_)
01024                                     - static_cast<int>(ptrSize));
01025     //(DB:PaddingEnd)If debug is on, set up the pad pattern in the padding
01026     if (_config.DebugOn_ && _config.PadBytes_)
01027       std::memset(theCharPtr, PAD_PATTERN, _config.PadBytes_);
01028     //(DB:PostPadding)If it is not the last one
01029     if (i != _config.ObjectsPerPage_-1){
01030       //(DB:PostPadding)Finished with padding block, move on
01031       theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,_config.PadBytes_);
01032       //(DB:InterAlign)Interalignment, memset all to align pattern
01033       if (_config.InterAlignSize_) 
01034         std::memset(theCharPtr, ALIGN_PATTERN, _config.InterAlignSize_);
01035       //(DB:InterAlign)Finished with the interalignsize, move on
01036       theCharPtr = OffsetPtr(theCharPtr,_config.InterAlignSize_);
01037     }
01038   }
01039   // Increment the amoutn of pages allocated
01040   ++_stats.PagesInUse_;
01041   // Return the pagePtr
01042   return pagePtr;
01043 }
01044 
01045 /**************************************************************************/
01054 /**************************************************************************/
01055 void ObjectAllocator::FreePage(GenericObject* thePagePtr){
01056   // If it is external header, delete all the headers first
01057   if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExternal){
01058     // Jump through all the headers
01059     MemBlockInfo** headerPtr = OffsetPtr(reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo**>
01060                                (thePagePtr),static_cast<int>
01061                                (sizeof(GenericObject*)+_config.LeftAlignSize_));
01062     for (size_t i = 0; i < _config.ObjectsPerPage_; ++i){
01063       // Grab the next header if it isn't the last
01064       if (i != (_config.ObjectsPerPage_ - 1)){
01065         MemBlockInfo** nextHeader = OffsetPtr(headerPtr,
01066         static_cast<int>(_config.HBlockInfo_.size_+_config.PadBytes_*2
01067         +_stats.ObjectSize_+_config.InterAlignSize_));
01068         // Delete the old header
01069         delete *headerPtr;
01070         // Set it to the nextHeader
01071         headerPtr = nextHeader;
01072       }
01073       // Just delete if not
01074       else delete *headerPtr;
01075     }
01076   }
01077   // Remove all the items in the free list which are part of it
01078   int amtOfItemsLeft = _config.ObjectsPerPage_;
01079   // Run through the free list
01080   GenericObject* freeListPtr = _freeList;
01081   GenericObject* prevListPtr = NULL;
01082   while(amtOfItemsLeft && freeListPtr){
01083     int offset = static_cast<int>(reinterpret_cast<size_t>(freeListPtr)) 
01084               - static_cast<int>(reinterpret_cast<size_t>(thePagePtr));
01085     // check whether it is within the boundaries of the page ptr
01086     if (offset >= 0 && offset < static_cast<int>(_stats.PageSize_)){
01087       // FOUND ONE! Remove it from the list
01088       if (prevListPtr != NULL) prevListPtr->Next = freeListPtr->Next;
01089       else _freeList = freeListPtr->Next;
01090       freeListPtr = freeListPtr->Next;
01091       --_stats.FreeObjects_;
01092     }
01093     else{
01094       // Go to the next freeListPtr
01095       prevListPtr = freeListPtr;
01096       freeListPtr = freeListPtr->Next;
01097     }
01098   }
01099   // Then delete the entire page
01100   delete [] reinterpret_cast<char*>(thePagePtr);
01101   // Decrement the amoutn of pages allocated
01102   --_stats.PagesInUse_;
01103 }
01104 
01105 /**************************************************************************/
01120 /**************************************************************************/
01121 size_t ObjectAllocator::GetPageSize(size_t ObjectSize, OAConfig& config) const {
01122   // Get the size of the front block first
01123   size_t frontSize = static_cast<size_t>(sizeof(GenericObject*))+
01124                        config.PadBytes_+config.HBlockInfo_.size_;
01125   // If the front size is not a multiple of the alignment, setup left align
01126   if (config.Alignment_ && frontSize%config.Alignment_){
01127     config.LeftAlignSize_ = static_cast<size_t>(
01128                             static_cast<int>(config.Alignment_)-
01129                             static_cast<int>(frontSize%config.Alignment_));
01130     // And increment frontSize
01131     frontSize += config.LeftAlignSize_;
01132   }
01133   // Next, get the size of each block (from the start of the data to right
01134   // before the start of the next data)
01135   size_t blockSize = ObjectSize + config.PadBytes_*2 + config.HBlockInfo_.size_;
01136   
01137   // If each block's size is not a multiple of the alignment, setup interalign
01138   if (config.Alignment_ && (blockSize+frontSize)%config.Alignment_){
01139     config.InterAlignSize_ = static_cast<int>(config.Alignment_) - 
01140                         static_cast<int>(blockSize+frontSize)%config.Alignment_;
01141     // And increment frontSize
01142     blockSize += config.InterAlignSize_;
01143   }
01144   // Done, return the total size
01145   return frontSize+blockSize*(config.ObjectsPerPage_-1)
01146                   +ObjectSize+config.PadBytes_;
01147 }
01148 
01149 /**************************************************************************/
01161 /**************************************************************************/
01162 bool ObjectAllocator::IsEmptyPage_Header(GenericObject* pagePtr) const{
01163   bool pageIsUsed = false;
01164   // Traverse through the headers
01165   GenericObject* headerPtr = GetFirstHeader(pagePtr);
01166   for (size_t i = 0; i < _config.ObjectsPerPage_; ++i){
01167     // If it is basic or extended, just check the useflags
01168     if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbBasic ||
01169     _config.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExtended)
01170     {
01171       if (Header::GetFlags(GetDataPtr(headerPtr),_config.PadBytes_))
01172         pageIsUsed = true;
01173     }
01174     // if it is external, grab the ptr to the mem block
01175     else if (_config.HBlockInfo_.type_ == OAConfig::hbExternal){
01176       // Grab the header
01177       MemBlockInfo* theHeaderPtr = reinterpret_cast<MemBlockInfo*>(headerPtr);
01178       // If it is used, use function
01179       if (theHeaderPtr->in_use) pageIsUsed = true;
01180     }
01181     // If the page is used, break the loop
01182     if (pageIsUsed) break;
01183     // Move to the next header if it is not the last
01184     if (i != _config.ObjectsPerPage_ -1) headerPtr = GetNextHeader(headerPtr);
01185   }
01186   return pageIsUsed;
01187 }
01188 
01189 /**************************************************************************/
01201 /**************************************************************************/
01202 bool ObjectAllocator::IsEmptyPage_NoHeader(GenericObject* pagePtr) const{
01203   // USE POINTER ARITHMETIC
01204   int amtOfItemsLeft = static_cast<int>(_config.ObjectsPerPage_);
01205   // Run through the free list
01206   GenericObject* freeListPtr = _freeList;
01207   while(amtOfItemsLeft != 0 && freeListPtr != NULL){
01208     // The offset of the free list obj from the list
01209     int offset = static_cast<int>(reinterpret_cast<size_t>(freeListPtr))
01210                 -static_cast<int>(reinterpret_cast<size_t>(pagePtr));
01211     // check whether it is within the boundaries of the page ptr
01212     if (offset >= 0 && static_cast<size_t>(offset) < _stats.PageSize_)
01213     // FOUND ONE! Decrease items left by one
01214     --amtOfItemsLeft;
01215     // Go to the next freeListPtr
01216     freeListPtr = freeListPtr->Next;
01217   }
01218   // If have items left, STILL HAVE ITEMS NOT IN FREE LIST
01219   if (amtOfItemsLeft != 0) return true;
01220   return false;
01221 }
01222 
01223 // Data block functions
01224 /**************************************************************************/
01232 /**************************************************************************/
01233 GenericObject* ObjectAllocator::PopFront() throw(OAException){
01234   // If it is empty, throw exception
01235   if (!_freeList) 
01236     throw(OAException(OAException::E_NO_MEMORY, "Allocate: Not enough memory"));
01237   // Grabs the first
01238   GenericObject* poppedObj = _freeList;
01239   // Changes the free list ot begin with the next
01240   _freeList = poppedObj->Next;
01241   // Decrement objects on free list
01242   --_stats.FreeObjects_;
01243   // Returns the popped obj
01244   return poppedObj;
01245 }
01246 
01247 /**************************************************************************/
01255 /**************************************************************************/
01256 void ObjectAllocator::PushFront(GenericObject* memBlock){
01257   //Make the old free list the next after the memBlock
01258   memBlock->Next = _freeList;
01259   // Make it the start of the free list
01260   _freeList = memBlock;
01261   // Increment objects on free list
01262   ++_stats.FreeObjects_;
01263 }
